column5: I have a 50 4 stroke. I want to add a tac and a tilt gauge. How is this done?  Thanx, Daniel OCH
Never knew there was a thing called a tilt gauge? I just go by my RPM gauge.

Here is a link for a small tach that Joe and I have used for many years.  tini tach link  The Trim gauge can be added to only a trim assy that is wired for it it can most often not be added after it is built. I have trim on my boats without the gauge and have found the tachometer works well for judging the correct position. I usually run on plane and trim up till the rpms jump up slightly then trim back a hair to find the best position.   Art
My trim gauge hasn't worked all year, but I'm not concerned with it. Once your accustomed to your boat, you can trim it to the best postion just by feel.
